channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MT

item.title: Report X-2024060622
item.description:
Report X-2024060622

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: BELGRADE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was leaking a resin which made the package itself very wet and sticky but did not spread past that. This package arrived to the Bozeman facility in this state and was not the result of human error at this facility. The package was put in a lined tote immediately and minimal cleanup was required as leak was almost entirely contained to the origin box itself. The leak was at the top of the box meaning it was mishandled before arriving here.

item.title: Report E-2024060370
item.description:
Report E-2024060370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBU experienced a UN3352 Omni Brand Lambda 1 EC release from 36 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to the cardboard packaging only due to lose caps on all jugs. The jugs were poured into (3) 55-gallon poly drums to be disposed of as pure liquids. The jugs were then rinsed, and all rinse water was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted cardboard, empty poly jugs, and impacted pads were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
